definition: to abridge (a text)/to edit out (of a movie)/to cut back (a budget, a curriculum)
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: Characters create the life and efface the reminiscence.
sentences.chinese: 文字创造了生活，也删减记忆。

sentences.english: He slashed his work into a booklet with about 5,000 words.
sentences.chinese: 他将他的著作删减为五千字左右的小册子。

sentences.english: Education budget cuts prompted Filipino students to stage a strike in public universities.
sentences.chinese: 菲律宾国立大学学生因教育预算删减而发动罢课。

sentences.english: I enjoy the inclusion and deletion of space.
The Scope of the quality management system , including details of and justification for any exclusions .
sentences.chinese: 质量管理体系的范围，包括任何删减的细节和合理性。

sentences.english: It's a very skillful translation, but a more drastic abridgement than the publisher acknowleges.
sentences.chinese: 翻译很不错，但比出版商宣称的删减的更多。

sentences.english: Inbulge window head to eave distance.
sentences.chinese: 删减窗上口和檐口之间的距离。

sentences.english: So Lee agreed to make cuts.
sentences.chinese: 因此，李安同意做镜头删减。

sentences.english: It’s a process of subtraction more than addition.
sentences.chinese: 这个过程与其说是在增加倒不如说是删减。

sentences.english: Outside Evangelismos, there was concern among patients over the cuts to healthcare.
sentences.chinese: 医院之外，很多病人都在担心医疗保健会被删减。

sentences.english: In Britain, the film was released with an 18 certificate after ten seconds of cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在英国，影片在受到10秒的删减后被划分为18级。

definition: to abridge/to cut a text down to size for publication
to cut (from a movie etc)/to censor
fragment (of speech etc)/extract (from book etc)/episode (of story etc)
clauses and sub-clauses (in formal document)/entry (in a dictionary, encyclopedia etc)
